00040 #ifndef _world_cpp

00042 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 //The world that integrates everything
00044 //
00045 //This is where all the calls to the the underlying libraries should be from.
00046 //World is an abstraction layer to all of the non-ui libraries. The ui
00047 //layers wx and ogre both have their own main loops, so it is almost mandatory
00048 //for other code to interact with those libraries directly.
00049 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

00083     World::World()
00084     {
00085         Vector3 Lbounds(-1000.0,-1000.0,-1000.0);
00086         Vector3 Ubounds(1000.0,1000.0,1000.0);
00087         std::vector <ManagerBase*> temp;
00088 
00089         this->Construct(Lbounds, Ubounds, 10, "SceneManager", SceneManager::Generic, "Physgame.log", temp);
00090     }

00123     void World::Construct(  const Vector3 &GeographyLowerBounds_,
00124                                 const Vector3 &GeographyUpperbounds_,
00125                                 const unsigned short int &MaxPhysicsProxies_,
00126                                 std::string SceneManagerName,
00127                                 SceneManager::SceneManagerType SceneType,
00128                                 std::string LogFileName,
00129                                 std::vector <ManagerBase*> ManagerToBeAdded)
00130     {
00131         //Set some sane Defaults for some values
00132         this->SetWindowName("AppName");
00133         this->TargetFrameLength=16;
00134         this->HasSDLBeenInitialized=false;
00135         this->FrameTime = 0;
00136         this->OgreRoot = new Ogre::Root(crossplatform::GetPluginsDotCFG(),crossplatform::GetSettingsDotCFG(),"Physgame.log");
00137 
00138         //add each manager that was passed in to the manager list
00139         for(std::vector<ManagerBase*>::iterator iter = ManagerToBeAdded.begin(); iter!= ManagerToBeAdded.end(); iter++)
00140             { this->AddManager(*iter); }
00141 
00142         //Create and add any managers that have not been taken care of yet.
00143         if(this->GetActorManager()==0)
00144             { this->AddManager(new ActorContainerVector(this)); }
00145         if(this->GetGraphicsManager()==0)
00146             { this->AddManager(new GraphicsManager(this)); }
00147         if(this->GetSoundManager()==0)
00148             { this->AddManager(new SoundManager(this)); }
00149         if(this->GetResourceManager()==0)
00150             { this->AddManager(new ResourceManager(this)); }
00151         if(this->GetEventManager()==0)
00152             { this->AddManager(new EventManager(this)); }
00153         if(this->GetPhysicsManager()==0)
00154             { this->AddManager(new PhysicsManager(this,GeographyLowerBounds_,GeographyUpperbounds_,MaxPhysicsProxies_)); }
00155         if(this->GetSceneManager()==0)
00156             { this->AddManager(new SceneManager(SceneManagerName, SceneType, this)); }
00157         if(this->GetUIManager()==0)
00158             { this->AddManager(new UIManager()); }
00159 
00160         // This Tests various assumptions about the way the platform works, and will not act
00161         SanityChecks();
00162 
00163     }
00164 
00165     void World::SanityChecks()
00166     {
00167         //Perform a Test that only needs to be done once for the SDL/Physuserinputevent system.`
00168         Log("Verifying size of userinput events:");
00169         Log(sizeof(MetaCode::InputCode));
00170         Log(sizeof(SDLKey));
00171         Log(sizeof(int));
00172         if(sizeof(MetaCode::InputCode) != sizeof(SDLKey))
00173         {
00174             LogAndThrow("User input subsystem Event Sizes  Don't match, userinput subsystem will go down faster than 'that' girl on prom night.");
00175         }else{
00176             Log("External User input subsystem Event Sizes match, the User Input subsystem won't crash instantly");
00177         }
00178 
00179         if(sizeof(MetaCode::InputCode) != sizeof(int))
00180         {
00181             LogAndThrow("Internal User input subsystem Event Sizes Don't match, userinput subsystem cannot function.");
00182         }else{
00183             Log("Internal User input subsystem Event Sizes match, the User Input subsystem won't crash instantly");
00184         }
00185 
00186         TestLogger();
00187     }

00225         ActorBase* temp27=0;

00260     template <class T> void World::OneLogTest(T Data, string DataType, string Message1, string Message2)
00261     {
00262         try
00263         {
00264             Log(Message1+DataType);
00265             LogAndThrow(Data);
00266         } catch (T excepted) {
00267             Log(Message2+DataType);
00268             Log(excepted);
00269         }
00270     }
00271 
00272     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00273     //tears the world down
00274     World::~World()
00275     {
00276         //All the pointers Ogre made should get taken care of by OGRE
00277         delete OgreRoot;
00278 
00279         for(std::list<ManagerBase*>::iterator iter = this->ManagerList.begin(); iter!= ManagerList.end(); iter++)
00280         {
00281             this->ManagerList.erase(iter);
00282         }
00283 
00284         //remove sdl stuff
00285         SDL_FreeSurface(SDLscreen);
00286         SDL_Quit();
00287     }
00288 
00289     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00290     //appends to the gamelog which is managed by Ogre
00291     template <class T> void World::Log(T Message)
00292     {
00293         static stringstream Converter;
00294 
00295         static std::stringstream* Audiolog = 0;
00296         if (0 == Audiolog)
00297         {
00298             Audiolog = this->GetSoundManager()->GetLogs();
00299         }else{
00300             Converter << Audiolog->str();
00301             Audiolog->str("");
00302         }
00303 
00304         Converter << this->LogStream.str() << Message;
00305         this->LogStream.str("");
00306         Ogre::LogManager::getSingleton().logMessage(Converter.str());
00307         Converter.str("");
00308     }
00309 
00310     template <class T> void World::LogAndThrow(T Message)
00311     {
00312         this->Log(Message);
00313         throw(Message);
00314     }
00315 
00316     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00317     // Start the Game already
00318     void World::GameInit( const bool &CallMainLoop )
00319     {
00320         //#define PHYSDEBUG
00321         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00322         this->Log("Entering GameInit()");
00323         #endif
00324 
00325         this->LoadOgreSettings();
00326         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00327         this->Log("Loaded Graphics Settings");
00328         #endif
00329 
00330         this->CreateRenderWindow();
00331         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00332         this->Log("Created the Render Work");
00333         #endif
00334 
00335         for (std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator Iter=this->ManagerList.begin(); Iter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++Iter )
00336         {
00337             (*Iter)->Initialize();
00338             #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00339             this->LogStream << "Initializing " << (*Iter)->GetTypeName() << " Manager";
00340             #endif
00341         }
00342 
00343         if(CallMainLoop)
00344         {
00345             #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00346             this->Log("Starting the main loop");
00347             #endif
00348             this->MainLoop();
00349         }else{
00350             #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00351             this->Log("Not calling the main loop");
00352             #endif
00353         }
00354     }
00355 
00356     void World::MainLoop()
00357     {
00358         /// @todo create a lighting manager and put this in there
00359         //this->OgreSceneManager->setAmbientLight( Ogre::ColourValue( 1, 1, 1 ) );
00360 
00361         /*! @page mainloop1 Main Loop Structure and Flow
00362          The MainLoop is heart of most video games and simulations.
00363 
00364          @section mainloopoverview1 Main loop Overview
00365          The Main loop runs in World.MainLoop() which is called by default from @ref World.GameInit(). By default this Method also starts the render, the physics andthe input systems. It does very
00366          little on it's own. The main loop then calls the PreMainLoopItems(), DoMainLoopItems and PreMainLoopItems(), for each manager in the order of their priority from Lowest to Highest.
00367          \n Here is a listing of  default priorities for each of the managers the a world intantiates by default:
00368             -50 User Input and events
00369             -40 Actors
00370             -30 Physics
00371             -20 Camera
00372             -10 Lighting (Not yet implemented)
00373               0 Graphics
00374              10 Sound
00375              20 Resources
00376         */
00377 
00378         //As long as all the CallBacks return true the game continues
00379         bool DoNotBreak=true;
00380         while (DoNotBreak)
00381         {
00382             for (std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator Iter=this->ManagerList.begin(); Iter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++Iter )
00383             {
00384                 #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00385                 this->LogStream << "Current Manager: " << (*Iter)->GetTypeName() << " ";
00386                 this->Log( (*Iter)->GetPriority() );
00387                 #endif
00388 
00389                 if( !(*Iter)->PreMainLoopItems() )
00390                     { DoNotBreak=false; }
00391 
00392                 (*Iter)->DoMainLoopItems();
00393 
00394                 if( !(*Iter)->PostMainLoopItems() )
00395                     { DoNotBreak=false; }
00396 
00397                 this->DoMainLoopLogging();
00398             }
00399 
00400         }//End of main loop
00401 
00402         //Some after loop cleanup
00403         this->DestroyRenderWindow();
00404     }
00405 
00406     void  World::DoMainLoopLogging()
00407     {
00408         this->Log(this->LogStream.str());
00409         this->LogStream.str("");
00410     }

00416     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00417     //Loads the Ogre Configuration
00418     void World::LoadOgreSettings()
00419     {
00420         //Try loading from the default location
00421         if (!this->OgreRoot->restoreConfig())
00422         {
00423             //if we can't do that then lets make new settings
00424             if (!this->GetGraphicsManager()->ShowGraphicsSettingDialog())
00425             {
00426                 this->LogAndThrow("Error: Could not setup Ogre.");
00427             }
00428         }
00429     }
00430 
00431     void World::CreateRenderWindow()
00432     {
00433          //#define PHYSDEBUG
00434 
00435         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00436         this->Log("Entering CreateRenderWindow()");
00437         #endif
00438         /// @todo TODO set multithreaded SDL so it will the run event manager in another thread
00439         //Get what is needed for SDL started
00440         if (SDL_Init(SDL_INIT_VIDEO) < 0) {
00441             this->Log("Error 2: Unable to init SDL, SDL Error Follows:");
00442             this->LogAndThrow(SDL_GetError());
00443         }
00444         this->HasSDLBeenInitialized=true;
00445         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00446         this->Log("Initialized SDL");
00447         #endif
00448 
00449                 try
00450                 {
00451                         //Setup the SDL render window
00452                         this->SDLscreen = SDL_SetVideoMode( this->GetGraphicsManager()->getRenderWidth(), this->GetGraphicsManager()->getRenderHeight(),0, SDL_OPENGL);
00453                         SDL_WM_SetCaption(this->WindowName.c_str(), NULL);
00454                         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00455             this->Log("Successfully Setup SDL");
00456             #endif
00457                 }catch (exception& e) {
00458                     this->Log("Failed to Setup SDL");
00459                         LogAndThrow(e.what());
00460                 }
00461 
00462         //Start Ogre Without a native render window
00463         try
00464         {
00465             //crossplatform::WaitMilliseconds(1000);
00466             this->OgreGameWindow = this->OgreRoot->initialise(false, this->WindowName);
00467             #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00468             this->Log("Setup Ogre Window");
00469             #endif
00470         }catch (exception& e) {
00471                     this->Log("Failed to Setup Ogre Window");
00472                         LogAndThrow(e.what());
00473                 }
00474 
00475         //Configure Ogre to render to the SDL window
00476         Ogre::NameValuePairList *misc;
00477         misc=(Ogre::NameValuePairList*) crossplatform::GetSDLOgreBinder();
00478         (*misc)["title"] = Ogre::String(this->WindowName);
00479         this->OgreGameWindow = this->OgreRoot->createRenderWindow(WindowName, this->GetGraphicsManager()->getRenderHeight(), this->GetGraphicsManager()->getRenderWidth(), this->GetGraphicsManager()->getFullscreen(), misc);
00480         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00481         this->Log("Bound Ogre to an SDL window");
00482         #endif
00483 
00484         //prepare a scenemanager
00485         //this->OgreSceneManager = this->OgreRoot->createSceneManager(Ogre::ST_GENERIC,"SceneManager");
00486         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00487         this->Log("Created the Ogre Scenemanager");
00488         #endif
00489 
00490         //setup a default camera unless has been setup yet
00491         if(this->GetCameraManager()==0)
00492         {
00493             this->AddManager(new CameraManager (this->GetSceneManager()->GetName(),this));
00494             this->GetCameraManager()->CreateCamera();
00495         }
00496         this->OgreCamera = this->GetCameraManager()->DefaultCamera;
00497         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00498         this->Log("Created Default Camera");
00499         #endif
00500 
00501         //viewport connects camera and render window
00502         this->OgreViewport = this->OgreGameWindow->addViewport(OgreCamera);
00503 
00504         //setting the aspect ratio must be done after we setup the viewport
00505         this->OgreCamera->setAspectRatio( Ogre::Real(OgreViewport->getActualWidth()) / Ogre::Real(OgreViewport->getActualHeight()) );
00506         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00507         this->Log("Configured Viewport and Aspect Ratio");
00508         #endif
00509     }
00510 
00511     void World::DestroyRenderWindow()
00512     {
00513         this->OgreGameWindow->destroy();
00514     }

00531         }

00559     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00560     // Upper Management
00561     ///////////////////////////////////////
00562     void World::AddManager(ManagerBase* ManagerToAdd)
00563     {
00564         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00565         this->LogStream << "Calling World::AddManager("<<ManagerToAdd<<") size before:" <<this->ManagerList.size();
00566         #endif
00567         if(!this->ManagerList.empty())
00568         {
00569             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00570             {
00571                 if( (*ManIter)->GetPriority() > ManagerToAdd->GetPriority())
00572                 {
00573                     this->ManagerList.insert(ManIter, ManagerToAdd);
00574                     #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00575                     this->LogStream << " - Added by sorted insertion:"<<ManagerToAdd<<" - size after:" <<this->ManagerList.size() ;
00576                     #endif
00577                     return;
00578                 }
00579             }
00580         }
00581         ManagerList.push_back(ManagerToAdd);
00582         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00583         this->LogStream << " - Added by push_back:"<<ManagerToAdd<<" - size after:" <<this->ManagerList.size() << endl;
00584         #endif
00585     }
00586 
00587     void World::RemoveManager(ManagerBase* ManagerToRemove)
00588     {
00589         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00590         {
00591             // do nothing
00592         }else{
00593             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00594             {
00595                 if( *ManIter == ManagerToRemove )
00596                 {
00597                     this->ManagerList.erase(ManIter);
00598                     break;
00599                 }
00600             }
00601         }
00602     }
00603 
00604     void World::RemoveManager(const ManagerBase::ManagerTypeName &ManagersToRemoveType, short unsigned int WhichOne)
00605     {
00606         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00607         {
00608             //do nothing
00609         }else{
00610             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00611             {
00612                 if( (*ManIter)->GetType() == ManagersToRemoveType )
00613                 {
00614                     if(0==WhichOne)     // we use our copy of WhichOne as a countdown to 0
00615                     {
00616                         this->ManagerList.erase(ManIter);
00617                     }else{
00618                         --WhichOne;
00619                     }
00620                 }
00621             }
00622         }
00623     }
00624 
00625     ManagerBase* World::GetManager(const ManagerBase::ManagerTypeName &ManagersToGet, short unsigned int WhichOne)
00626     {
00627         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00628         this->LogStream << "Calling World::GetManager(Type:"<<ManagersToGet<<") searching through "<<this->ManagerList.size()<<" Items.";
00629         #endif
00630         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00631         {
00632             return 0;
00633         }else{
00634             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00635             {
00636                 if( (*ManIter)->GetType() == ManagersToGet )
00637                 {
00638                     if(0==WhichOne)     // we use our copy of WhichOne as a countdown to 0
00639                     {
00640                         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00641                         this->LogStream << " - Got:" << *ManIter <<endl;
00642                         #endif
00643                         return *ManIter;
00644                     }else{
00645                         --WhichOne;
00646                     }
00647                 }
00648             }
00649         }
00650         #ifdef PHYSDEBUG
00651         this->LogStream << " - Got:Nothing" << endl;
00652         #endif
00653         return 0;
00654     }
00655 
00656     void World::UpdateManagerOrder(ManagerBase* ManagerToChange, short int Priority_)
00657     {
00658         ManagerToChange->SetPriority(Priority_);
00659         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00660         {
00661             ManagerList.push_back(ManagerToChange);
00662         }else{
00663             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator ManIter = this->ManagerList.begin(); ManIter!=this->ManagerList.end(); ++ManIter )
00664             {
00665                 if( (*ManIter)->GetPriority() > ManagerToChange->GetPriority() )
00666                 {
00667                     this->ManagerList.insert(ManIter,ManagerToChange);
00668                 }else if(*ManIter == ManagerToChange )
00669                 {
00670                     this->ManagerList.erase(ManIter);
00671                 }
00672             }
00673         }
00674     }
00675 
00676     void World::UpdateManagerOrder()
00677     {
00678         if(this->ManagerList.empty())
00679         {
00680             //do nothing
00681         }else{
00682             std::list< ManagerBase* > temp; //(this->ManagerList.begin(),this->ManagerList.end());
00683             temp.swap(this->ManagerList);
00684             for(std::list< ManagerBase* >::iterator TempIter = temp.begin(); TempIter!=temp.end(); ++TempIter )
00685             {
00686                 this->AddManager(*TempIter);
00687             }
00688         }
00689     }
